title: Citrix debt deal prices with large losses for banks; Bank of America, Credit Suisse and Goldman Sachs lose $500 million on debt for Citrix buyout in a troubling sign for private equity dealmaking.
text:
The banks BAC CS GS additionally sold a $4.1 billion loan at a 9% discount to face value, with losses north of $100 million, the people said.

Vista Equity Partners and Elliott Management Corp.'s private-equity arm Evergreen Coast Capital struck the deal to buy Citrix in late January, before the selloff in stocks and bonds accelerated. In all, the transaction is to be funded with about $15 billion worth of debt.
